posts.name: Big Al's Diner
posts.note: The compact diner is dishing up generous portions of breakfast all day and hearty American fare at lunch. When I was at Big Al's Diner, I ordered the cheese omelette with rye toast and corned beef hash. It was a huge plate of food.
posts.cptn: Cheese omelette, rye toast, and corned beef hash at Big Al's Diner in Cleveland, Ohio

posts.name: Crop Bistro & Bar
posts.note: Bank turned sleek, upscale New American eatery with a chef's table and a focus on local ingredients.

posts.name: Frank's Bratwurst
posts.note: Frank's has been serving bratwurst that is like no other, derived from a secret recipe that has gone through rigorous research and development. Franks' Bratwurst makes some of the best bratwurst sandwiches and other sausages too. You need to order a few different kinds with friends so you can try them all.

posts.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
posts.note: Iconic microbrewery with house suds, an updated American menu, free tours and a patio.

posts.name: The Greenhouse Tavern
posts.note: Hip haunt with locally driven New American fare, a rooftop patio, and creative cocktails.

posts.name: Happy Dog East
posts.note: Happy Dog East serves quarter-pound hot dogs with creative toppings plus live music and 75+ tap beers in a convivial space.

posts.name: Hot Sauce Williams
posts.note: Family-friendly barbecue joint is known for its Polish Boy sandwich, fried chicken and mac 'n' cheese.

posts.name: Lola Bistro
posts.note: Michael Symon's New American eatery serves rustic fare in a sleek, bustling setting.

posts.name: Noodlecat
posts.note: Japanese soba, udon and ramen dishes using local ingredients, with vegan and gluten-free options. They have many great types of Ramen. I order the crispy beef ribs Ramen. I also, order the deep fried walleye steamed bun along with a Japanese honey and hot sauce deep fried chicken steamed bun.

posts.name: Sokolowski's University Inn
posts.note: Sokolowski's University Inn is a family-owned landmark serves cafeteria-style Polish classics in homey surroundings.

posts.name: Steve's Gyro's
posts.note: If youâ€™re craving a gyro, they ask that you arrive early. Steve's Gyro's do sell out early every day, and because of that, they do close earlier than scheduled Market hours. I liked it so much I went back the next day to get one to have for lunch for the road trip home to DC.

posts.name: Slyman's Restaurant
posts.note: Retro breakfast and lunch deli known for corned beef sandwiches served in simple diner digs.

posts.name: West Side Market
posts.note: Grand, bustling public market from 1912 featuring vendors for meat, produce, bread and hot food.

posts.name: West Side Market Cafe
posts.note: The West Side Market Cafe is a casual eatery in the historic market, dishing up down-home American eats for breakfast and lunch. I ended up ordering an omelette with home fries, rye toast, and a side sausage.
